See, for example, Litzenberger and Rabinowitz (1995). If futures prices are below the current spot price, the futures curve is said to be backwardated. Litzenberger and Rabinowitz make the distinction between weak and strong backwardation. If discounted futures prices are below the spot price, they say the futures curve is weakly backwardated. Contango is the opposite of backwardation.
